parametrized_description: A disease testing station conducts a temperature check and/or a blood test on each patient. A temperature check takes TimeTemperatureCheck minutes while a blood test takes TimeBloodTest minutes. The testing station must conduct at least MinBloodTests blood tests. The temperature check is required to be performed at least TempToBloodRatio times as many as the blood tests. If the testing station has a total of TotalStaffMinutes staff minutes, how many of each test or check should be done to maximize the number of patients seen?

TimeTemperatureCheck.description: Time taken to perform a temperature check

TimeBloodTest.description: Time taken to perform a blood test

MinBloodTests.description: Minimum number of blood tests required

TempToBloodRatio.description: Minimum ratio of temperature checks to blood tests

constraints.description: The total time allocated for temperature checks and blood tests cannot exceed TotalStaffMinutes minutes.
At least MinBloodTests blood tests must be conducted.
The number of temperature checks must be at least TempToBloodRatio times the number of blood tests.

objective.description: Maximize the number of patients seen by conducting temperature checks and blood tests.
objective.formulation:
Max\ PatientsSeen 
 PatientsSeen \leq TemperatureChecks 
 PatientsSeen \leq BloodTests 
 TimeTemperatureCheck \cdot TemperatureChecks + TimeBloodTest \cdot BloodTests \leq TotalStaffMinutes 
 BloodTests \geq MinBloodTests 
 TemperatureChecks \geq TempToBloodRatio \cdot BloodTests
